THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON
08.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

rc
Crl.MC.No. 8796 of 2018 2 2019IKERII66
ORDER

The petitioner, defacto-complainant in C.C. No.345 of
2002 on the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-V,
Thiruvananthapuram has approached this Court seeking for a
direction to the court concerned to expedite the proceedings in
the above case and to dispose it of within a time frame.

2. The case came up for admission on 20.12.2018 and
this Court had directed the court concerned to report the
present stage of the case. Accordingly, the said court had
reported that the case was originally taken on file as C.C.
No.164 of 1999. Accused Nos.4 and 5 were absconding at
that point of time and therefore, the case against them was
split up and refiled as C.C. No.345 of 2002. The trial against
accused Nos.i to 3 were already over and they were
convicted. The case records were submitted before the Court
of Sessions, as Crl.R.P.No.225 of 2002 is pending consideration
there. Thereafter, the records of the case were received back
by the court on 25.05.2006 and incorporated with the case.
But, certain relevant documents were found missing from the
case bundle and earnest efforts are being taken to trace it out.
It is reported by the court concerned that, for the reason, the
trial in the case could not be proceeded with at an expeditious

pa
Crl.MC.No. 8796 of 2018 3 2019IKERII66
manner. It is reported by the court concerned that the trial
could be proceeded with only when the missing documents are
traced out. It is also reported by the Magistrate that the case
stands posted to 15.02.2019.

3. The learned counsel for the petitioner has submitted
that the marriage of the petitioner's daughter is scheduled
after two months and his presence is required for
accumulating funds for the marriage.

In the event of the matter reported by the court
concerned that necessary documents are missing, there is no
meaning in directing the court to dispose it of in a time bound
manner. However, direction is issued to the court concerned to
take all earnest efforts to see that the documents are traced
out and to proceed with the trial at the immediate possible
opportunity.

With the above directions, the Crl.M.C is disposed of.
MARY JOSEPH
JUDGE
NAB
